page.title: 14Children's clubs
page.content: In Penkridge there is a variety of clubs and societies which are available for young people. There is a great range of Brownies, Guides, Cubs and Scouts. Brownies are taken from ages 7 to 10 and Cubs from 8 to 11. They take part in charity appeals and learn homecraft and useful skills. The Brownies also go on pack holidays and practice what they have learnt. Scouts and Guides are a follow up from Brownies and Cubs. Other groups include The Boys Brigade and The Girls Brigade. The Boys Brigade is similar to the Scouts but it is for boys from unsecure homes. Red Cross and St. John's help people at fetes etc. and Red Cross also helps people across the world in need. There is also disco dancing and horse riding available for children in Penkridge.
